channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: This is BBC Four
channel.desc: Programmes start at 7.00pm.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Fred Dibnah's Magnificent Monuments
channel.desc: Steeplejack Fred Dibnah tours Britain admiring some of its engineering marvels. This edition takes in Preston, County Durham, St Paul's Cathedral and York Minster.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Bolsover Castle with Lucy...
channel.desc: Worsley: Secret Knowledge. Lucy Worsley tells the story of Bolsover Castle in Derbyshire.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Japan's Master of Restoration
channel.desc: The Mayuyamas travel to London to examine a priceless 18th-century Imperial Chinese flower vase. They hope studying the London vase can help them restore a very similar piece.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Around the World in 80...
channel.desc: Treasures: Ethiopia - Ark of the Covenant. Dan Cruickshank visits Ethiopia in search of the Ark of the Covenant.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Tribe
channel.desc: Explorer Bruce Parry spends time living with the Suri people of Ethiopia. Contains scenes which some viewers may find disturbing.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Stephen Poliakoff Remembers... Shooting the Past
channel.desc: Stephen Poliakoff looks back on his 1999 drama series Shooting the Past.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Shooting the Past
channel.desc: A three-part drama serial by Stephen Poliakoff about a picture library facing closure. An American property developer arrives in London with some bad news for a photo archive.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Shooting the Past
channel.desc: Curator Marilyn has to sack the library's resident expert, Oswald, and begin the task of finding a buyer for the whole collection. Contains some strong language.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Shooting the Past
channel.desc: Concluding Stephen Poliakoff's drama serial. Marilyn rushes to Oswald's house to find that he has taken an overdose. She discovers key clues to Anderson's past.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Grand Hotel
channel.desc: The lives of a diverse group of guests intersect during an eventful few days at a luxury Berlin hotel. Classic star-studded drama from MGM studios.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Garbo, by Joan Crawford
channel.desc: Joan Crawford narrates a programme, first broadcast in 1969, that looks at Greta Garbo's art and life through her films. Featuring extracts from Camille, Queen Christina and Ninotchka.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Casablanca
channel.desc: Classic romantic drama. Rick's Cafe is a centre for criminals, refugees, resistance fighters and Nazis. Its cynical owner takes risks for no-one - until the arrival of Ilsa.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: In the Heat of the Night
channel.desc: Thriller about the bigoted sheriff of a small Mississippi town who finds himself forced into collaboration with a black detective from Philadelphia.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Sky at Night
channel.desc: The team delve into the enigmatic world of pulsars and hear the inspiring story of their discoverer, Dame Jocelyn Bell Burnell, direct from the subject herself.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Art on the BBC
channel.desc: Art historian Katy Hessel explores the BBC archives to create a television history of the father of impressionism, Claude Monet.

channel.title: Garbo, by Joan Crawford
channel.desc: Joan Crawford narrates a programme, first broadcast in 1969, that looks at Greta Garbo's art and life through her films. Featuring extracts from Camille, Queen Christina and Ninotchka.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Anoushka Shankar at the Proms
channel.desc: The sitar superstar joins forces with conductor Robert Ames and London Contemporary Orchestra to perform a newly orchestrated version of Chapters, her trilogy of studio albums.

channel.title: TOTP
channel.desc: Tommy Vance presents performances from Ultravox, David Bowie, ELO, Mike Berry, Grace Jones, Village People, Sue Wilkinson and ABBA, plus a dance routine from Legs & Co.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Heartbreakers at the BBC
channel.desc: A selection of classic heartbreaking BBC performances from some of music's biggest stars, including George Michael, Amy Winehouse, Sam Smith, Taylor Swift and soul legend Dionne Warwick.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Heartbreakers at the BBC
channel.desc: More of the greatest sad songs ever, featuring classic tracks from the likes of Sade, The Righteous Brothers, Toni Braxton and Lewis Capaldi.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Heartbreakers at the BBC
channel.desc: Some of music's biggest stars pour their hearts out in this selection of classic performances from the BBC's archives.

channel.title: Britain's Wild Places
channel.desc: Documentary about the huge skeins of geese that fly out of Atlantic skies to spend winter on the Scottish island of Islay.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Miss Marple
channel.desc: Miss Marple stays at Bertram's Hotel and is soon caught up in the mystery of a missing cleric, a crime ring, and larceny.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Miss Marple
channel.desc: Miss Marple concludes her stay at Bertram's Hotel by solving the complex case.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Beck
channel.desc: After a brutal murder, Alex teams up with Josef and a suspended Vilhelm. Contains some strong language, prolonged violence and upsetting scenes.
